content:
Art. 4.216. 
Revocation by a later will 
Later wills which do not expressly revoke earlier wills only revoke those provisions contained therein which are incompatible with the new wills or which are contrary thereto.
A revocation made in a later will has full effect, even if the new will remains unexecuted due to the incapacity of the legatee, or due to his refusal to collect.
